Reviews.Title: “Like coming home”
Reviews.Author: abno1
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel a number of times, but never written a review before, yet every time I leave I am so pleased that I tell myself I simply MUST do so. The staff at this hotel are warm, welcoming, helpful and efficient. I travel constantly for business and that combination is rare. And my room is always spotless, definately making me comfortable it is thoroughly cleaned. Not just a quick sweep theough i feel at some hotels. The location is great for me, convenient to my office but also easy to get to so many fun restaurants and shopping areas. I went to the west village on this last trip. It was so close and so fun. And all of the comments about the train do not bother me at all. I've heard it, but it shuts down at night and has never once affected my sleep. Highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “If Train Noise Does Not Bother You...”
Reviews.Author: CPaq
Reviews.Content: ...you will be fine. This is an excellent facility EXCEPT for the pair of train tracks running both in front and behind the hotel. The restaurant served a very enjoyable and varied menu selection. The rooms were clean and well appointed with updated furniture and amenities. The front desk and the breakfast staffs were very helpful and friendly. If you are a light sleeper, however, be prepared to be awakened at least twice per night by the passing trains. There is a major thoroughfare crossing the tracks across the street from the front door, so the trains must sound the horns many times as they approach it...all night long.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel if you don't mind train whistles”
Reviews.Author: RyanC78
Reviews.Content: Room was very clean with new carpeting. The hotel unfortunately is right next to the train tracks and regardless of your room location you will hear the trains as they pass by and sound their whistle. Service was good and food was above average. If you're a heavy sleeper stay here with no worries, if not keep searching.

Reviews.Title: “Noisey, old, run down”
Reviews.Author: Jim N
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights, and was serenaded each night by loud trains every hour, did not sleep much as a result. The room was clean bu run down, and the bathroom smacked of the 1980's. On two days my wake up call did not happen, and it made for some frustrating moments. I travel a lot, and would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Heartbreak Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Crysha
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at this Holiday Inn for business. I'm calling this review heartbreak hotel because it represented a step down from previous HHs I've stayed at in the past. What made the hotel a heartbreak was its dismal state. It seems to have been worn down by many visitors. The rug in my room was frayed, there was a pervasive smell in the hallway and the room, and the ice machine on my floor was continuously broken my entire stay. I didn't use the hotel restaurant, but I did use the fitness room It has adequate facilities. I say adequate because some of the equipment was broken (tv on treadmill and at least one of the treadclimers, tread on treadmill loose). I'm glad they had something to help me unwind at the end of a busy day anyway. The biggest area in need of improvement is housekeeping. When I checked in, my bath and bedding was covered with random hairs. I left a note for housekeeping requesting linen changes and they took care of the problem the next day. On the third day of my stay, I noticed gum on the carpet just outside one of the elevators on my floor. After many hours of it not being addressed, I went down to the front desk to report it. Next morning, the gum was still there, but most of it removed by late afternoon. Unfortunately, remnants of the gum remained until I departed two days later. Throughout my stay, dishes left outside rooms after room service stayed in the hallway for many hours and sometimes overnight. Despite some of the negatives, this hotel did brisk business. From entry until exit, the staff was always gracious, helpful, and in good spirits. They made staying at the hotel a joy. The hotel is near a medical complex, a trade center, and off a major highway and near public transportation (the train ran right by my room); a good location. The clientele were varied. There are few restaurants in the area, but a bit of variety (diner, sushi, Italian, fast food) within a one-mile radius. Despite some of things that need improvement, this hotel was a pleasant place to stay because of the atmosphere if nothing else.You can tell when people are really trying to do their best and that's what the hotel staff represented above all.

Reviews.Title: “Great chef”
Reviews.Author: Ted W
Reviews.Content: One of the best stays ever. We travel a great deal, this was almost like being home. Chef Ray created some of the best food, was extremely satisfied. Usually we dine at different locations each night, the food was so good we had dinner at the hotel the entire week of our stay, it is that good. My wife can't eat things like butter, salt and a few other items most enjoy, Chef Ray made plates that were not only something my wife could enjoy but were healthy for her. Chef Ray the next time we are in Dallas we will be staying here again, thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Dissapointing For A Holiday Inn”
Reviews.Author: Sierras_Road41099
Reviews.Content: We received a great group rate for the room for our Convention. I read a Trip Advisor Review from a guest who said his room was cold. He continued to say regardless of what the Thermostat was set on, the temp or heat would not rise. I thought this was an isolated problem that I surely would not have to experience. The Temp in the 'first' room we entered on the 5th Floor was cool, and set on 72. We ran the setting to 85, but the unit continued blowing 'cool' air. Thinking about the above mentioned review, I went down to the desk to request a Blanket. The attendant seemed shocked that the room had no heat; but his response was "are you in a King room" I said yes, and he asked would you like another room, I said yes. So they moved me around the corner. Thinking ahead I came into this room to set the thermostat so it would begin to get comfortable for our return, & Increased the setting to 85. Upon our regrouping to the 'new' room, I noticed that the temp was still cool and I increased the temp to the max, put my hand over the vent and felt cool air. So we turned the unit off. We are still cool and even with the requested thin blanket, we slept cool. I tried to call my Wife in the old room to tell her to gather up our things. I called to the old room twice, but she said she heard no signal or anything after answering the phone. Now in our new room the phone is silent. Some hotels deactivate phones when the room is empty to keep housekeeping from using them, perhaps due to their inattentiveness they failed to activate our phone. I do not know. An additional note, she bought a can of soda from the hotel mart, and the can top was so cruddy it was disgusting.

Reviews.Title: “Really Nice Hotel, Nice Staff”
Reviews.Author: lindsey b
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this Holiday Inn on a crew layover. Nice hotel, very modern, really big, well decorated rooms. Flat screen tvs. Staff was nice. Room service woman was really awesome. I wish I could remember her name because she deserves kudos. Only downside is if you are on a layover without a car there isn't much nearby to do. But for anyone with transportation, great hotel, great price, great location, great staff.

Reviews.Title: “good choice for market hall area of dallas”
Reviews.Author: achristie
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 1 night for a seminar in the area. Friendly staff, comfortable bed, flat panel tv with a good selection of channels, great water pressure in the shower - room was very clean. My only complaint is our inability to adjust the room temperature to our liking. The thermostat doesn't have a/c or heat, you can only adjust the temperature up or down. We could get all the hot/warm air we wanted, but we thought the room was too hot and stuffy - we finally just turned it off and the room cooled down eventually. Overall a good choice for the area and I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel - fantastic staff!!!”
Reviews.Author: cjfcha
Reviews.Content: I was very impressed with the staff at this hotel. They truly went out of their way to help you. I will definetly be back and recommend you try them too.

Reviews.Title: “Great place!”
Reviews.Author: bigred041
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel on our way to Ca. And liked it so much we made a point of stopping on the return. The staff is incredibly friendly, helpful, and competent. The rooms very comfortable and the diner next door is great for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel; Dog Friendly!”
Reviews.Author: mandyrey
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel twice in 2011 and enjoyed my stay both times. It was convenient to my location in Dallas, and since I had my dog with me both times, I can say they were very accommodating to my needs when traveling with a pet. The first time, I needed to check in early and they were more than happy to help. The other time, I needed a later checkout (6 p.m.) and they did not charge me extra. The hotel was clean and spacious. I'd definitely recommend for work/travel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Experience with the staff”
Reviews.Author: T T
Reviews.Content: Thank you for the great service, Ignacio and Lacey at the front desk and Cleveland in the shuttle. We enjoyed getting to know you all a little better and look forward to another visit.

Reviews.Title: “Ahhh-mazing!”
Reviews.Author: Lisa H
Reviews.Content: We are two travel nurses who came to Dallas on a work assignment. We were supposed to stay in a different hotel but decided very quick that due to condition of the room and the unfriendly staff we were not going to stay. We stumbled upon Dallas Market Center Holiday Inn and from the time we entered the door we were treated like royalty! The manager Scott Sisk took great care of us! Even the restraunt staff go above and beyond! We will definately stay here again and have passed on the word to other travel friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: g0net0beach
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay here last week as we were attending a conference in Dallas. They offered free shuttle to and from Dallas Convention Center. There were many restaurants nearby. If you like Mexican Food then I would recommend a place called Ojeda's, you will not be disappointed. The only one thing I could say negative thing I could say about our stay is that they did not offer shuttle one night to return us to hotel after they had drop us off. This is why I gave them a 3 instead of 5. They gave us no warning about shuttle, we were locked out of convention center at 9pm and had to find a cab which was very difficult. Overall I would recommend this Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: Ralph J
Reviews.Content: I recently reserved aroom for my wife and daughter at the Dallas Market center Holiday INN. My wife came back and said it had been a long time since she had service like this. She had nothing to say but good things. The room was booked with reward points which generally means for other brand motels lowest room available and no service. She siad it was the exact opposite. I spoke with the staff personally and was amased at the speed and professionalism a minor problem was handle. I have nothing else to say except... All my future stays in the Dallas area will now be exclusivly at the Dallas Market Center Holiday Inn....... GREAT JOB!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “If you like trains, this is your hotel!”
Reviews.Author: JosieMcA
Reviews.Content: Hotel was clean, rooms vey nice and roomy. Restaurant food was very good and excellent value. Wait staff was superb. The hotel is situated between 2 train tracks. The train runs all day and most of the night. Whistle blows are extremely loud! Even earplugs didn't work and sleep was intermittent. Ask for a room on the back side of the hotel and you will only get a few trains during the night. The track on the front side has trains about every 30 to 45 minutes. The diner next door is excellent as well. I would not stay here again due to the trains. Otherwise the hotel was very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing fancy but okay”
Reviews.Author: living≤arnin
Reviews.Content: Trip Advisor has been used for several years to learn about hotels before I leave for my stay even if I use Hotwire to book my trip as I did in this case. This visit was one more case where reading the reviews of other travelers prepared me for my stay. My priority is that the rooms and property are clean and safe. This Holiday Inn was better than the average Holiday Inn. Based on my visit, I recommend this hotel to other travelers. Parkland Hospital is nearby. The hotel offers free transportation within a 5 mile radius if conferences are in those locations. My room was small but clean, neat and reasonably updated. Nothing fancy but okay. No smoke or perfume smell. Clean. Neat. Parking lot has dark areas. Most guests avoided the dark areas. The staff was professional and courteous. Housekeeping in my room was excellent. While I did not eat in the dining area, there were many who did. There was a diner across the street which is the only food service nearby. Many cars were there. The train station is about a 15 minute walk south of the hotel and Parkland Hospital is about a 20 to 30 minute walk. The metro train runs very close behind the building. Train horn sounded about every hour on the weekend until about 9pm at night and trains until about 10:30 at night. The beds were firm but not hard. The blankets were used by everyone. I prefer the sheet layer with the blanket in the middle, but these were the only blanket on the top. The TV was flat screen. The bathrooms were small but a small dressing area made it bigger. My toilet was slow to flush which I attributed to the age of the building. None of these occurrences discouraged me. The meeting rooms were smaller than other Holiday Inns. The pool area was an okay size with chairs and extra towels. The fitnes room was up to date. The parking area is large but spread out. The building is curved which makes the rooms the slight shape of an angle. This was a Days Inn which explains why this is not a typical Holiday Inn structure. Weekend breakfast buffet is $12.95 per person. . Dinner runs about $18.00 per person. Shortly after arriving, I received a call from the staff about my satisfaction with the room. A wine glass from a previous guest was left outside my door prior to my arrival. I asked that it be picked up and 24 hours later, the glass was still there. I moved the glass to the table in front of the elevator and it was picked up. I guess this is how they handle room service cleanup in full service hotels in Dallas:-) I would stay here again and recommend it to others. This Holiday Inn seems to have good management which helps travelers have a better stay.

Reviews.Title: “It's worth the stay for the price!”
Reviews.Author: Courtney B
Reviews.Content: My hubby and I stayed there for a rest night while moving to California...The price was great, staff was nice, and they accommodated our pets well! The location was decent...nothing in walkable range, but a short 2-3 mile drive to most places. The only "bad" feed I have is the rooms never got overly chilled, just a humid cool. Also, we be cautious with drinks at the bar, we spent $30 on 2 drinks ( granted they were both doubles) Overall, we enjoyed our stay! Courtney Bourgeois

Reviews.Title: “ABOVE EXCELLENT SERVICE”
Reviews.Author: Amanda E
Reviews.Content: I stayed here this past weekend for a Ambit Energy conference that was held at the near by Hilton Anatole. From the second I checked in the service was absolutely amazing! Although the rooms were average and kind of small (there were random hairs in the shower and on the last night there was a small baby lizard running around the bathroom) and the hallways are EXTREMEMLY confusing, the service that I recieved while staying there was some of the best i've ever recieved. The hotel is a short walking distance from the Anatole so its location for the weekend was amazing for it's price. The location otherwise kind of sucks though (the train runs across the street so it can get a little loud; nothing too bad though) It's about a 20 min drive to DFW (so be prepared to pay for an over-priced Dallas taxi) and the only restaurant other than the nearby Hotel restaurants is a diner across the street (I heard it was pretty good) and a Denny's up the block. (service was horrible here) Luckily they have a restaurant/bar in the hotel that was suprisingly pretty good. The chef Ray is one of the coolest people I met during my trip. Not to mention that he can actually cook (had pizza and the steak meal which were both very good) And the person who served and rung me up, Miguel, was also very nice. Overall this hotel's facilities were just average but the service here would definately make me want to stay again. Some of the nicest and most helpful people I encountered while in Dallas. --Amanda

Reviews.Title: “Best visit ever!!!”
Reviews.Author: Beth V
Reviews.Content: Our son & 3 co-worker's were care flighted to Parkland Hospital Burn ICU, back on May 19, 2011. From the minute we arrived at the hotel, we were given the upmost courtesy, care, and concern. The entire staff was very accomodating and so helpful. They took care of all our need's so much, that we could just concentrate on the crisis at hand & not worry about anything else. It is hard to mention just a few name's, since everyone was so kind & good at their job. We had so much fun with the restaurant staff, which gave us a little down time from our problem's at hand. All the staff behind the desk, in the lounge, on the floor in general, were the best people & so kind. They turned a nightmare of a reason we were there, into something pleasant and often time's fun. You have a wonderful staff and we will never forget them. We will be back, just to say hi & visit with them. Thank everyone so much for the wonderful stay. You deserve a 5 star, A+ rating.

Reviews.Title: “Just ok”
Reviews.Author: Mjtaylor409
Reviews.Content: It's not bad but not as clean as I would have liked. The bath mat was dirty and their were random hairs in the bathroom and on the sheets. There are lots of hotels in this area so I probably would not suggest this one.

Reviews.Title: “Could do better”
Reviews.Author: 7dust
Reviews.Content: It's not the Holiday Inn standard. It's more like Holiday Inn Express. OK, rooms are huge (actually it was a room, a bedroom and a small kitchen). But the rooms are very worn out and seem old. Also the hotel is far from everything with exception of railway tracks :) Definitely not 4 stars hotel. But a decent 3 stars.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Service, Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: brandypsmith
Reviews.Content: I had a wonderful experience with this Holiday Inn. I typically stay at Marriot Hotels but was unable to this time and I found the Holiday Inn that was located closed to down town Dallas and every where I needed to go. This hotel has changed my opinion of Holiday Inns and I would recommend this hotel to anybody and I would definitely stay in this Holiday Inn again. I experienced great service from the time I walked in the hotel until I left. The rooms were very clean and everybody that works at this hotel has great customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Good service, suite was nice”
Reviews.Author: VacationMom13
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a volleyball tournament a few weeks ago. I am glad we had a car, because it is really easy in and out of the city. Very central location, but it would have been a pain to take the train (though the hotel reps said it was easy, it was at least a five min walk to the train terminal). The front desk was very helpful and had upgraded us to a suite, which was great. Our suite was spacious and it was great to unexpectedly have a kitchen. The others on our team were in an adjoining room and it was more dated than the suite. I ordered room service one night and it was prompt and the food was excellent. The front desk was very accomodating with a very large group of people staying. Overall, the accomodations were fine for a large group and would have been fine for a family overnight, but nothing to really right home about.

Reviews.Title: “You Get What You Pay For”
Reviews.Author: kat00731
Reviews.Content: The hotel was only $85/night when we were there, which was super cheap compared to downtown. However, we didn't get our room cleaned for 2 days, and the rooms hadn't been "updated" in awhile it seemed. No free breakfast, but there is a cute little diner across the street. Overall we liked it, but next time we might pay extra to stay downtown and be closer to everything.

Reviews.Title: “A swing and a miss....”
Reviews.Author: Shishkabob
Reviews.Content: I booked the room for a conference in downtown Dallas. I entered my reservation in the Holiday Inn website and specifically asked for the lowest possible floor. I hate elevators and heights and it's not an unreasonable request. When we checked in, we were booked into a room on the 9th floor. Room 915 to be exact. When we got in the elevator the age of the place really started to show. The wallpaper covering the old paneling in the elevator is pealing and is held on by masking tape. While walking down the hallway to the room we noticed several water damaged ceiling tiles. The ceilings are only about 6 or 7 foot tall. I'm 5'6" and I can touch the ceiling so it's a short room. The room itself wasn't bad. No complaints about the quality of the mattress or linens. Later when I returned to the room after dinner and stepped over to plug in my laptop by the bed I cut my foot on a 4 inch piece of raw metal bedframe sticking out of the side of the bed. And through the night, the trains across the street came chugging and whistling through. The last night we stayed Dallas had unprecedented thunderstorms. The staff did get everyone downstairs and kept the bar open while we waited to see if the tornadoes were coming our way. When we were released to go back up there were large trashcans collecting rain water in the hallways where the roof was once again leaking. I could give them a break because of the strength of the storm, but considering there were other stained ceiling tiles from other rains, this seems like a long-term problem.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and more than I expected!”
Reviews.Author: blakemoore
Reviews.Content: I got stuck in Dallas during an ice storm and stayed at this hotel. After reading the other reviews I think people just like to complain....the rooms were nice and temp was just right...the managers of the hotel were even scraping the Ice and snow off all the cars in the parking. THE BEDS AT THIS HOTEL ARE FANTASTIC! The staff was great....there is a guy at the front deck named Nathan that gave us the best customer service ever....I usually stay at 5 star hotels and because of the superbowl in town I was unable to on this trip,however the next time I come to Dallas I will stay at this hotel...

Reviews.Title: “DON'T STAY HERE!”
Reviews.Author: Share09
Reviews.Content: I just spent 4 nights in this hotel and have to warn future travelers about it. First of all, the rooms (i can speak for friends staying in other rooms as well) were scorching hot. After turning the thermostat to the lowest temperature setting, the room was still unbelievably hot. Recognize too that the first two nights i was there, the temperature outside was approximately -9 celsius (16 F) and STILL we couldn't cool the room off, even after shutting the power off on the thermostat. Furthermore, if you did happen to fall asleep, it wasn't for long as there were trains running by the hotel blairing their horns starting at 5:00am. Trust me... avoid this one

Reviews.Title: “Don't spend your money here ever”
Reviews.Author: ltcmentor1121
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel during Market, I stayed on the 4TH floor. Upon checking in I was treated with respect, after staying 1 night there I noticed the next day I had no hot water. I called down to front desk and ask if someone could move my room there is no hot water. The response was we are sold -out; I stayed in the room got up the next day and still no hot water. I went to front desk to make a complaint; front desk person was very rude to me I believe his name was Nathan. Nathan talk to me like I was stupid, about knowing hot water from cold water. Very rude not understanding at all. I noticed when I was making complaint others were making complaints of smells of sewage in their room and in the hallways. This hotel needs a total renovation I will tell all my peers do not stay at this property during market or for any event in Dallas, TEXAS. Beware Superbowl fans do not book this place to stay. I am very upset with this property lack of understanding a person needs, no hot water, smells of sewage, rude customer service and did not give me a discount or refund bad service.

Reviews.Title: “Centrally located, but a bit noisy”
Reviews.Author: Knights82
Reviews.Content: Needed a hotel room for one night in Dallas and was awarded this place via Priceline ($47+). A bit difficult to find but a good location if downtown Dallas is in your plans. Pros: Location, price, friendly staff Cons: Noise (with a railroad track across the street and a light rail line behind the building, it isn't a good place for light sleepers), worn decor (especially in elevators)

Reviews.Title: “The hotel was average, the staff was outstanding!”
Reviews.Author: Pinelee
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights on business. The shuttle took us everywhere we need to go and the drivers were excellent and very friendly and personable. It is a little out of the way for shopping or nightlife activities. The front desk people were very courtious and helpful. The rooms were standard hotel rooms, ours, unfortunately, got a view of the back lot, but some of the others travelling with us had a nice view of the city. I wouldn't really consider this hotel for a vacation destination, but for business it served us well.

Reviews.Title: “Euro-toilets not adequate for purpose”
Reviews.Author: HoustonEx
Reviews.Content: A notice on the restroom wall announced that they are testing new, 'green' toilets for saving water. They didn't flush adequately and worked so poorly that we called for maintenance. The maintenance guy was prompt and friendly, but said the toilet was working properly. My years of 'experience', both in and out of hotels, tells me 'not really'. Overall the staff was friendly, the hotel was up to the price, but I wouldn't stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A tad shabby but good value”
Reviews.Author: ozmaofoz74
Reviews.Content: This is not the newest or the nicest Holiday Inn property I have stayed at, but it IS a great deal for the price. Staff friendliness and competence rates very high with me - I'll take a couple of cracked tiles in the bathroom if the front desk staff don't act like they don't know why I am bothering them. This Holiday Inn has a fabulous staff. Attentive front desk. Restaurant manager helped us with luggage!!! The room was worn, but very clean, Carpets in hallway were a tad yucky and ice machines on several floors did not work, but like I said - great rates in a great location (15 minutes from museums by hwy, 10 minutes to the Whole Foods by road). My only real complaints was that there was no mini-fridge in room and the beds were a tad spongey. Despite that, I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Large room, convenient place”
Reviews.Author: hevvo_Tokyo
Reviews.Content: I visited there to go to Dallas and Ft. Worth. Since I did not have a car, #26 and #44 buses running in front of the hotel were useful (10 minite ride to West Transfer Center, downtown Dallas). The TRE station Medical/Market Center is in the 15 minute walk. The room was big enough for a solo traveler, and it was quiet and I had a good sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Treasure”
Reviews.Author: Oakcliff214
Reviews.Content: when I arrived at the Hotel I was so over whelmed by the cleanliness,design,and the alert staff ready to assist me upon entering. I had purchased the room on line at a economical price so I had no idea that i would be staying in such a nice place like this for the amount I paid.The room was excellent with pool view,comfortable beds along with flat screens tV's. I was greeted with smiles and eager eyes ready to help at any moment and a special thanks goes out to front desk clerk(Shante) who really did do everything she could to makemy Bithday weekend memorable while staying there.Thanks!

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, Great Food, Mustapha Rules”
Reviews.Author: Mjo55gew
Reviews.Content: I normally spend 4-5 nights on the road so believe me when I say....I know good service. Mustapha delived great service, very prompt and the food from the Hotel was good for the menu. I had 2 Grilled Chicken Breast and they were done perfect. Moist and tender. Mustafa follow-up with a great dessert and fresh coffee. Make sure to give Mustapha a visit in the hotel restaurant! Great Job!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with easy access to downtown Dallas. Good Value.”
Reviews.Author: tpp658
Reviews.Content: Attended convention in Dallas - convention hotels were too pricey. This hotel was newly renovated, spacious rooms, reasonable restaurant and FREE shuttle to Convention Center and airports. Saved 70% over "recommended convention hotels". Pool and exercise room available. More than that the staff was extremely helpful when I needed to find a pharmacy and checked on me upon my return.

Reviews.Title: “Your are truly a 'quest' at the Holiday Inn Market Center”
Reviews.Author: cabel1309
Reviews.Content: We choose this hotel because of its proximity to the Southwestern UT Medical Center but we were pleasantly surprised by the quality of the hotel. The staff operates like the staff of a five star hotel. Every staff member was helpful, friendly and courteous. We received assistance from the shuttle drivers for the best time and place to arrive for our medical appointment. The manager guided us to great dining in downtown Dallas. The front desk staff, waiters in the restaurant and even the bar help treated us like family. Many compliments to this hotel and the atmosphere provided for their guests.

Reviews.Title: “Good all round quality”
Reviews.Author: skywalker11
Reviews.Content: Myself and my husband stayed here and they could'nt have been more helpful, they rebooked us straight back in when we found out we could'nt get home because of volcanic ash, and to have a shuttle bus in a 5 mile radius is brilliant, all the staff were very pleasant our thanks to them all, not forgetting Cleveland and Joe the shuttle drivers, (good guides), beds very comfy and I loved that train!! Marilyn Stonebank

Reviews.Title: “Amazing staff”
Reviews.Author: rodgermclane
Reviews.Content: After a medical emergency my family, and I stayed at the Holiday Inn Dallas Market Center to be near Parkland Hospital. On the way to Dallas I called and spoke with Roxie who was very nice and helpful. I requested a late check in and when we arrived Archie was also very understanding of our situation. Our family looked like we had been hit by the train across the street (figurativley) and we were still treated as if we were their highest priority. The manager/assistant manager Peter was very helpful with our situation and helped us make reservations for our next trip. I would suggest this hotel to anyone staying in the area. I didn't hear any traffic noise or train noise. We are from a rural area and those things would normally keep us a wake but as I said we didn't hear anything once we were in our room.

Reviews.Title: “I would reconsider for another hotel selection”
Reviews.Author: jennydinh2
Reviews.Content: I am here because of my cousin wedding. There is absolutely nothing in this place, you cannot order movies, there is no spa, they dont know their own password on their very own computer and the list goes on. We had 5 rooms reserved for our staying and most of the room we stayed in had some problems. There is no heater, the shower drain lever had to be held down enabling to drain water. Ran out of mini-beds for the kids although it looks like barely anyone is here.

Reviews.Title: “Out of town, but dont worry!”
Reviews.Author: TravellingManGD
Reviews.Content: This is a very adequate hotel with very helpful staff and a friendly quiet bar area. It is about 3 miles out of town but the hotel shuttle runs frequently and will take you in and pick you up if you give them a call and tell them where you are. Very useful! Our room was spacious and very comfortable

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: BigRob28
Reviews.Content: This is the frist time that I stayed in this particular area. The construction is a little bit messy but it is tolerable. The train is not a problem is you get a room or ask for one on the other side of the building...Actually, I did not hear it at all... OMG, THE BEDS ARE TO DIE FOR...VERY, VERY NICE... Great price, great location. I will stay here again...

Reviews.Title: “What is that smell? Room 410 and 411”
Reviews.Author: CWDRLOVE
Reviews.Content: I write this review from my room or should I say my third room. After a quick check in my husband and I get in the room and I walk into the bathroom in my bare feet and walk over a very wet floor. When I mentioned it to my husband, he commented "that must be where the smell is coming from". About the time I got everything where I wanted it the smell becomes unbearble. We call the front desk to request air freshener and to tell them about the wet floor. They responded quickly and send housekeeping and maintenance to the room. After a check and half a can of air freshener we were offered another room, the room next door. We get everything packed up and walk in to ahhh a new room....that smells worse than the first. Smoking in the room could only help the room smell! I go immediately to the front desk to request yet a third room. I explain the smell and that there is something seriously wrong and that maintenance need to investigate the rooms then they need to be cleaned and aired out. I was asked if I wanted to talk to a manager, but I tell the nice young lady that I only want a non smelling room. They give us a room in a different area of the hotel. Now I understand that sometimes things happen or break, until.... this morning as we were leaving for the day we walk past the front desk to hear another guest complaining about the smell in their room, room 410. Then we start checking some online reviews and we find that the smell has been an ongoing problem. Instead of fixing the problem, they continue to put guests into rooms that have issues in hope that they will stumble across a guest that won't complain. That is not right. Either address the issue and clean the room from top to bottom after it is fixed or don't use the rooms. The restaurant was a little high on the prices and not really that good, at least for dinner. we did not have breakfast. The rooms are good size and the shower is ok. They seem small because the round current rod was installed to far into the bathtub area. The train noises are not too bad. If you are tuned out you won't really hear them. Over all I don't think we will stay here again. I don't like the fact that they are ignoring a problem. It makes me wonder what else they are over looking.

Reviews.Title: “Please don't Pick this one!”
Reviews.Author: m1lowe
Reviews.Content: The hotel is right beside the train tracks. The noise bothers you all night long. The floor of my room was rarely vacuumed after staying there for four days. My 1 year old got scabies from crawling on the floor of our room. The hallway had a foul odor.The staff was nice and the price is reasonable but you will regret it. There is no breakfast bar and pets are allowed.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, but not as good as first time”
Reviews.Author: SopranosFan
Reviews.Content: I originally stayed here a little over a year ago and wrote a separate review at that time. Hotel is nice overall and I would stay here again and would recommend it to anyone. I booked a room here on Priceline for $55 a night. I booked my stay on Priceline for the wrong date and showed up at the hotel 1 week early but they fixed that easily since they had a great staff for check in. The pool was not yet open but they could do a better job of keeping it clean. There was paper floating in it and dirt on the bottom - very unsightly. There were a couple of TV channels the hotel wasn't getting due to some cable problem. And as the other reviewers have noted - the fitted sheet does not fit the bed at all. At night it keeps coming off the bed. The mattress is deeper than the sheet is made for so it does not cover it adequately. Everything else was okay. The food was good, ate at the restaurant twice. Try eating at the Market Diner for lunch and breakfast for some great food that is not as expensive as the hotel food. The hotel food was a bit costly. Overall I enjoyed my stay here.

Reviews.Title: “great staff”
Reviews.Author: FrankRSydney
Reviews.Content: The bed was great however the sheets were slightly too small for the bed and kept coming loose. The staff were very helpful and friendly. Internet service/business centre free to use. Very good internet service. Television service very poor, snowy. Analogue service, that may change when the digital service commences in 2009. The lift was noisy in the corridor. There was no refrigerator.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Option”
Reviews.Author: attachphotos
Reviews.Content: Hotel stay was pleasant, the room and bathroom were clean, the location- convenient short drive to downtown Dallas. Staff was nice. We would definitely recommend it !

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay at the Hilton Inn-Dalas Market Center”
Reviews.Author: LouisianaSnowflakes
Reviews.Content: The rooms were very nice, the staff was friendly, helpful and courteous. Everything that we requested was given prompted attention. All areas were clean and functioning properly and the security was visable which made me feel safe. For the price of the hotel, it is well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel Considering...”
Reviews.Author: imesra
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a King Suite on the weekend of a huge college football game and car show. October 10-12 2008. We were very late checking in, so I called ahead and spoke with a nice lady named allison who was able to check me in over the phone so I didn't have to worry about it when we got to the desk. Check in was at 3 and we didn't arrive until about 10 or 11 at night. We arrived and allison had told me to present my card to the desk and they'll take care of me as I did what I was told, the man there swore he didnt see my name in the system and made me feel a little dumb for not mentioning the fact that I had already been checked in and that I just needed my room keys. He had borderline attitude, but I was up working since very early morning and did not want to deal with him so I just let it slide. Staff needs to be happy at all times. The problem was quickly solved though. There is a bit of construction going on right now in that area, so be careful. The room was a little less than what I expected for the price. The televisions were nice and the room was spacious. Everything was clean. I think they could have chosen a color other than brown for a bathroom. It came off a little dirty but it wasn't. I dont like the fact that whoever will be next in the room will eventually see that their maintenance person stuffed a cardboard piece in the shower handle to hold the screw in. It was soggy by the time we checked out so someone will have to deal with a water leak soon. If you are in town on a big event weekend, I suggest getting a suite and requesting or bringing ear plugs. After very long work days, I had to hear shouting from the football fans across the halls. We were in the corner so we were grateful for that. Again, too tired to mention it to staff. We ordered breakfast to the room which was about 8 dollars per person and we appreciated that they offered milk and juice along with eggs cooked as you like them with potatoes fried in bell and red peppers. Very tasty and filling for the price. I requested a 930am delivery and they were right on time. I was very impressed. We also had phone troubles and my husband called the front desk for help and said he would go down there to make the call, but before he could get out the door, room service was knocking on our door to help him. Also very impressed. I wish I could have gotten his name and I wish we carried cash, otherwise we would have given him a tip for being so patient, professional, and courteous. A great man, whoever he was. The only negative part of our trip was the morning of checkout. We were getting ready to shower and it was about 10am when we hear three knocks on the door and all of a sudden the door opens. I am naked at this point and have to run to the bathroom because I felt like they were trying to come in the room. We heard no "room service" or anything like that. Our bill, along with another person's bill was then slid under the door. We travel quite a bit and this is the first time this has happened. usually, they will just slide it under the door. What happened was unacceptable. I highly suggest management has a serious talk with their staff about entering rooms because I know alot of people including ourselves, who travel with handguns legally. Announce yourself when you knock. That was all we ask. My husband spoke with someone from the front desk to save a space for us for our car but the message was never delivered to the next shift so when we got to the hotel room at around midnight no one knew about our reserved space. So the nice security guard walked my husband outside to show him his car and told him he would park him under the security camera overnight. That man was very helpful and considerate to our needs. The lady at the check out desk heard about our experience and though I didnt feel it was necessary, she deducted a night's stay from the visit. Im the type of person who doesnt ask for discounts. If there is a problem, just dont let it happen again. She was very very understanding and sincere and whoever she was, we appreciate it. The thing that stood out was the fact that while we were explaining ourselves, she never once looked away, she kept her eye contact, and she let us talk before she put her opinion in. Even though the bad stuff happened, the lady at check out kind of wrapped up our total feelings of the place. She left a lasting positive impression on us because she made us feel like we werent taking up her time. We usually stay at higher end hotels, so we expect great service. For the money, this hotel met and even exceeded some of our expectations. This is a great place to sleep with soft sheets and even nice artwork on the walls.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed blessing”
Reviews.Author: desertdenizen
Reviews.Content: This hotel has been on Harry Hines Blvd. a long long time, but has been a Holiday Inn for a comparatively short time, and has recently been remodeled and refurbished. Rooms are very attractive and have great beds. Everything is fresh, inclluding the small bathrooms with nice new fixtures. And the price is good. However, the staffing leaves a lot to be desired. Check-in was performed by a very friendly but inexperienced clerk who confused my home address as shown in the computer from the reservation with my birthplace listed in my passport and asked a bunch of silly questions. Then we went up to the room and encountered an overpowering sewage odor that even permiated the room. The room featured a great HDTV, but there was no remote. A second call to the desk got a snotty retort (Hey, she's going room to room to find you one, okay???). When "she" did bring the remote it didn't have batteries in it. A third call brought to the door the looming big tall source of the previous snotty remark, self-described as the duty manager, who was more agressively hostile than any clerk I've ever encountered anywhere. He tried to barge into the room to personnally test the remote, the implied presumtion being that I was either too addled to operate it or just someone who wanted to hassle staff. Neither was the case, though I am technically skilled enough to check remote control devices for batteries before giving them to someone else! Breakfast was fair but overpriced for the minimal selection. The restaurant manager was the only server and he seemed to be run ragged. Sunday morning checkout required a substantial wait and the very kind housekeeping manager to come and help get all the luggage downstairs since there was no bellman on duty. The friendly but inexperienced desk clerk was back on duty and I gently suggested that he NOT chew gum while dealing with customers. There are worse places but there are also better.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly adequate--you'll get a good night's sleep”
Reviews.Author: Kalisbon
Reviews.Content: It's true what the other reviewers say. The hotel apparently has been renovated. I got a king sized bed, non-smoking and everything was fine. The bathrooms were clean, with fresh towels each day. The pool, which I didn't use, was cleaned daily. The flat-screen t.v. got plenty of channels, which was great because there's not a whole lot to do in market center OR downtown Dallas from what I could see. The free shuttle to and from downtown was a lifesaver, as I had gotten the wrong impression that public transportation around the city was good. Very quiet, too, save for the occasional commuter train which could be heard off in the distance. Staff extremely helpful and eager to please. The food was, well, kind of Sizzler like, although breakfast was perfectly fine. I'd stay again, but I truly hope I've seen the last of Dallas.

Reviews.Title: “Just what you would expect”
Reviews.Author: IncredibleAsia
Reviews.Content: This is exactly what you would expect from a Holiday Inn. This hotel was recently renovated with new furniture and resurfaced bathroom walls and floors. The layout of the rooms is the same old 1950â€™s style, but functional and clean. Thereâ€™s nothing fancy, but for $108/night you get what you pay for. There is free in-room Internet access which many hotels charge for. The cooked to order breakfast at $8 was complete and good value for the money. Convenient to Dallas Market with free regular shuttle service. Best of all, no hidden charges like other hotels. Also, I left my laptop power cord, and they found it for me.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: kervin0819
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed 1 night at the Holiday Inn Market Center. The stay was perfect. The atmostphere was up to date and beautiful. Everything was very clean. Bathrooms include granite counter tops. Check in was very quick as was check out. Everyone there whether employees or guests were in very business attire. The parking lot is very lighted. Very clean rooms and had a fresh smell. Definitely will be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Everything is New”
Reviews.Author: FrugalTravelor
Reviews.Content: Any review before January 2008 should be ignored. This is a newly renovated property. The staff is doing a good job and trying hard to please. See Tonyraisins' review elsewhere on this site. The photographs are just as I found it.

HotelInfo.Name: Holiday Inn Dallas Market Center
HotelInfo.Address: 4500 Harry Hines Boulevard, Dallas, TX 75219 (Formerly "Days Inn")
